places_to_visit.name: Sagrada Familia
places_to_visit.description: The Sagrada Familia is an iconic basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí. Known for its intricate facades and towering spires, it's a masterpiece of modernist architecture and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

places_to_visit.name: Park Güell
places_to_visit.description: Park Güell is a public park designed by Antoni Gaudí, featuring colorful mosaics, whimsical structures, and panoramic views of Barcelona. It's a great place to explore Gaudí's unique artistic style.

places_to_visit.name: La Rambla
places_to_visit.description: La Rambla is a bustling street in the heart of Barcelona known for its vibrant atmosphere, street performers, shops, and cafes. It's a popular area for strolling and experiencing local life.

places_to_visit.name: Gothic Quarter
places_to_visit.description: The Gothic Quarter is the historical center of Barcelona, characterized by narrow medieval streets, charming squares, and historic buildings like Barcelona Cathedral. It's a great area to explore on foot.

places_to_visit.name: Casa Batlló
places_to_visit.description: Casa Batlló is another Gaudí masterpiece, known for its whimsical architecture, colorful facade, and intricate interior design. It's a prime example of modernist architecture and a must-visit landmark.
